author: ajsutton
content:
Subsecond would be ideal - timeouts of 10s per request are pretty typical and anything over a minute gets very hard to handle. 
If you look at requesting data for fault dispute games you may be making quite a lot of calls for blocks up to 30 days old (games will have resolved before then but you donâ€™t want to stop monitoring games the instant they resolve as the idea is to pick up if they resolved incorrectly or if there was some kind of anomaly). If each call takes a long time you either need to be able to make a ton of them in parallel or monitoring cycles take forever.
